title: Brute Force Attack
description:
Analyze this /var/log/auth.log snippet. How many FAILED login attempts did IP 10.10.14.5 make?

Jan  5 09:01:12 server sshd[1234]: Failed password for root from 10.10.14.5 port 43210 ssh2
Jan  5 09:01:14 server sshd[1234]: Failed password for root from 10.10.14.5 port 43211 ssh2
Jan  5 09:01:15 server sshd[1235]: Failed password for admin from 10.10.14.5 port 43212 ssh2
Jan  5 09:01:17 server sshd[1236]: Accepted password for admin from 192.168.1.10 port 52100 ssh2
Jan  5 09:01:18 server sshd[1237]: Failed password for root from 10.10.14.5 port 43213 ssh2
Jan  5 09:01:20 server sshd[1238]: Failed password for user from 10.10.14.5 port 43214 ssh2
Jan  5 09:01:22 server sshd[1239]: Failed password for test from 10.10.14.5 port 43215 ssh2

Submit as: flag{number}
hints: Count lines with 'Failed password' AND IP '10.10.14.5'
Ignore the 'Accepted' line â€” that's from a different IP
Count: root(3) + admin(1) + user(1) + test(1) = wait, recount carefully
